class SIMD_API TopicDescription

Detailed Description

The WaitSet can be used in alternative to DDS::WaitSet to leverage the automatic dispatching provided by Condition.

Author:
Angelo Corsaro <mailto:angelo.corsaro@gmail.com>

Definition at line 16 of file runtime.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

dds::~WaitSet (  ) 

Destroys this and unregisters all the conditions that are still attached.

Member Function Documentation

void dds::dispatch ( const ::dds::Duration_t &  timeout  ) 

Waits for at least one of the attached conditions to trigger and then dispatches the events, or, times out and unblocks.

Waits for at least one of the attached conditions to trigger and then dispatches the events.

a vector containing the triggered conditions
void dds::wait (  ) 

Waits for one of the attached conditions to trigger.

Returns:
a vector containing the triggered conditions
void dds::wait ( const dds::Duration_t &  timeout  ) 

Waits for one of the attached condition to trigger or for a timeout to expire. The attached conditions that have been notified before the expiration of the timeout are returned by the call.

Parameters:
timeout the maximum amount of time for which the wait should block while waiting for a condition to be triggered.
dds::WaitSet ( const ::dds::Condition &  cond  ) 

Creates a new WaitSet and attaches the condition passed to the ctor.

Parameters:
cond the condition to be attached to this wait-set.
dds::WaitSet (  ) 

Creates a new WaitSet which has not condition attached to it.
